website_summaries.verdict: A basic tool with several practical features. This affordable "all-rounder" is the best deal on the market.

customer_reviews.title: Item does not have 4% accuracy through the entire range.
customer_reviews.text: I work in calibration lab so when I received this torque wrench I took it into work to verify if the accuracy was indeed 4%. The torque wrench was not accurate to 4% in the lower ranges. The torque wrench also is not properly aligned as far as readings go. It is actually 10FtLb over what you would think it would be when you set it. I am just doing a 1 for 1 swap for another torque wrench. I will also be testing the new one that I receive to verify that I am getting what I pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Jk

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Got this for prime day and luckily I was doing a brake replacement on my truck so decided to but this. The other reviewers are right. Mine came looking like its been used before. Scratches and marked up throughout on the item. I can get over that. What I can't get over is that it doesn't work! It doesn't click and I even tested it on a lower setting. I'm disappointed and will be returning it. Maybe you'll have better luck
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work. Broke my bolt in the middle of the job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do the spark plugs on my truck. It worked okay I’m guessing at the lower torque value which I think was around 15 ft- lbs. Fastforward, I’m replacing a hanger on the suspension and it called for something around the 40 ft-lbs and the wrench never clicked indicating I reached the torque value. Long story short, I slowly twisted the head right off the bolt and I’m making a trip to the store buy a torque wrench that works and a new bolt. Don’t buy this cheap crap, learned my lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Y.

customer_reviews.title: I was hoping the larger wrench would be better quality but it was not
customer_reviews.text: Worked once or twice out of the box then quit returning to neutral position after it clicked. This is the third Tekton torque wrench I've had and none have worked for very long. One, an inch pound torque wrench, was replaced under warranty, however, the replacement failed a little over a yer later. I was hoping the larger wrench would be better quality but it was not. I'm a not a professional mechanic and use the tools on my own cars - they don't get used very often so they should last quite a long time.
customer_reviews.author: WTB

customer_reviews.title: Out of the Box Defective
customer_reviews.text: As usual I always test a new torque wrench before putting it on a bolt or nut. Especially an inch-pound wrench. No matter what the wrench was set to it would not click. Finally something internally gave way and it just broke in my hand. This could have easily broken a small bolt leaving a real mess to fix. Returned to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mark McClure

customer_reviews.title: Adequate for home use, but nothing more.
customer_reviews.text: These might work well for the home mechanic, but In my tire store with 15 employees these simply didn't hold up at all. They feel stout and functioned well for a little while. bought 5 and the first failure happened within a few days. Within 2 weeks, 4 out of 5 had stopped working. The mechanism inside the head broke on 3 of them and they spin freely in both directions. The 4th failed when the handle end came unthreaded and wouldn't screw back in, like the threads were stripped. For occasional use these should be just fine, but on 50+ cars a day these just aren't holding up. Not to be mistaken for commercial grade.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron M.

customer_reviews.title: Heck of a deal!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this torque wrench to maintain my motorcycles and vehicles. I used my Craftsman Digi-Click 3/8in drive torque wrench to compare. Both seemed to be exactly the same to each other. I bumped the Tekton up 1/2lb and it would tighten the lug nut ever so slightly. I used the Craftsman as the base of my measurements, ranging from 15ftlbs; 30ftlbs; 40ftlbs; 50ftlbs; 60ftlbs; and 75ftlbs. The Tekton mirrored the Craftsman digital torque wrench throughout the test range. The build of the Tekton seems to be solid; I had no issues with the head bolts coming loose, though I will blue loctite them to be on the safe side. I have no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Clint Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Let’s see if the supplier notices revues.
customer_reviews.text: It came apart during being used the first time. Well out of return date of course! As I was needing to torque the wheel nuts for a 900 mile drive, I had to rush round to Harbor Frieght and purchase a tool. Not sure what to do with the Teton now. I contacted Anazon - they IMEDIATLY issued a return ticket! One aberration in a tool doesn’t condemn them all. .One helpful return for a faulty item - well out of the regular date return period - that says a lot. Thank you Amazon for supporting a customer 😊
customer_reviews.author: Pubmaster

customer_reviews.title: Buy Something Else - This is defective
customer_reviews.text: I needed to install a brake caliper with 40 foot/lb of force. This torque never provided an audible click, causing me to over-tighten the bolt and strip the threads on the caliper. So now I am out $200 since I have to replace the caliper. Thanks for nothing, Tekton.
customer_reviews.author: CDesperado

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Broke after just a few uses.Weird grinding noises when changing torque setting, and no longer clicks when torque setting is reached. Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: CA472

customer_reviews.title: Weak Tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about 4 years ago for my home shop. VERY lightly used. Used it for the 5th or 6th time recently... Just torquing lugs on a Corolla to 80 ft-lbs, and the rachet failed. Now it just spins freely, an expensive paper weight. Emailed Tekton, but no response after a couple weeks. This wrench was always clean and kept in the original case. Just plain defective.
customer_reviews.author: TJP

customer_reviews.title: Been suffering with Harbor Freight for years... shame!
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT quality torque wrench for a fraction of the price of a SnapOn or other name brand. And I think it's just as good. Look, for $40 you aren't going to get a torque wrench that can be used 10 times a day and beat up in the process and have it last a lifetime - like a SnapOn. But for $40 you CAN get a good quality torque wrench that you can use occasionally with excellent results and it can/will last you a decade or two. If you don't have money burning a hole in your pocket, buy this torque wrench.
customer_reviews.author: woodmantech

customer_reviews.title: Its huge
customer_reviews.text: 3/4 drive Its my 3rd tekton have had good luck with all. Got the big boy for axles and the occasional big project. Nice wrenches all, wish they could work in both directions but no big deal. Keep my older torque wrenches calibrated old school with a scale and good old math, havent had to touch the tektons yet, couple years monthly use on the first two, plenty accurate and consistent for my needs
customer_reviews.author: pickerguy

customer_reviews.title: Great torque wrench
customer_reviews.text: This torque wrench looks very well built and very solid. I used it to tighten crankshaft pulley bolt to 181 lb ft, and also for tightening lug nuts. Worked great. The only minor drawback is that the scales on the knurled handle (the black handle) and the tool handle do not line up perfectly. You just need to use the scale on the knurled handle as your precision scale. For example these two photos show the wrench set at 25 and 50. For the cost of this tool, that minor drawback is not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: The accuracy is very good! Feels great to use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to torque down caliper bolts and lug nuts just to double check it torqued them down enough. Before even taking my wheel off, I set the torque wrench to 94 and checked all 5 lug nuts and it clicked immediately! The wheels were last torqued by Costco after getting new tires. This gave me the confidence that the accuracy is great. I then checked the torque on my TSX at 80lbs and it also clicked right away. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Okay for an inexpensive wrench, but not for accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I think it's hard to knock a torque wrench for <$30, but if accuracy is important, I don't think this is the right one to buy. I was trying to set the torque to 31 ft/lbs for an oil drain plug, and there seems to be a fair bit of "slop" when trying to set the range to an exact torque. This wrench is probably better suited for heavy torques such as setting your tire lug nuts.
customer_reviews.author: RickS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these in September of 2018. About a year later, I started to have some minor problems with the wrench. I reached out to Tekton Customer Care and within 2 days a replacement was sitting on my doorstep. You can't ask for better support than that. I already have a few Tekton tools and I will definitely be buying more. Thanks, Tekton!
customer_reviews.author: RavenManiac

customer_reviews.title: Defective on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I bought this torque wrench specifically to correctly torque the two oil pan drain plugs on my 2014 Corvette. The existing torque wrenches I have either had a higher range or were an older type spring torque readout. I thought this would do the trick for my application. Unfortunately, after setting the wrench for 18 ft-lbs, the wrench failed to "click" at 18 ft-lbs and I think I ruined one of the two drain plug threads. Could never get the new torque wrench to "click" at anything near the set value. Worthless piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking...
customer_reviews.text: Used for a couple years very sparingly and only on my Harley's. I always stored it at its lowest setting and recently it caused me to over-torque a bolt ultimately warping a primary cover. It just stopped "clicking" letting me know I was torqued to correct spec. Now I've got to buy a new primary cover and a new torque wrench. IMO look elsewhere and find something that will last.
customer_reviews.author: obz

customer_reviews.title: Overall very good, but adjustment could be a little smoother
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace an old craftsman digitork that failed. Overall I'm very happy with it, and have quickly grown to actually prefer this style over the digitork. My only gripe is that that setting action could be a little smoother. Don't get me wrong, it doesn't take a gorilla to turn it, it's just feels a little crusty in places. External fit and finish are very good. I'm sure over time it'll feel more consistent as the threaded surfaces wear in a bit.
customer_reviews.author: NetMagi

customer_reviews.title: This Tekton Torque Wrench is Smooth, Easy to Adjust and Has A Quality Feel
customer_reviews.text: Since purchasing this Tekton torque wrench, I've used it many times. It's much more smooth than my HF torque wrenches. If feels like a precision tool, unlike my less expensive torque wrenches. I plan to replace my other torque wrenches with Tekton. I needed this wrench because many of the torque specs on my GMC Sierra exceed 150 ft. lbs. This Tekton torque wrench can dial up to 250 ft. lbs. The wrench adjustment is smooth and easy to read, which is a must with my aging eyes! The wrench length makes it easy to hit the specified torque. You can easily hear and feel when the proper torque spec has been achieved.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: The value is good. You definitely get what you pay for when it comes to a torque wrench, so I wouldn't recommend using this for highly precise engine builds. But with that said, its a great product that I use to torque my wheels and suspension components on my cars. Pro: -Works well -Great value -easy to use Cons: -Not sure of the accuracy -the setting lock is temperamental. -Adjusting torque setting isn't as straight forward as other torque wrenches used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Handle scale doesn't match up as directions indicate it should
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these delivered to in case the first just had a defect. The directions tell you to twist the handle until the top of it reaches the line for the desired number and the zero is centered on the vertical line. This isn't possible... once the top of the knurled handle reaches the desired number the zero has passed the center line. It's about 8-10 ft.-lb beyond. It comes out of the box like this. I'm returning the second one as well and looking for a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Family Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Works for a few uses, even when carefully used as directed.
customer_reviews.text: I am a retired laboratory technologist, so I am careful when working with fine instruments. The first one soon became useless when the finely threaded nut at the end of the wrench became stripped. I was able to get a replacement from the manufacturer but that wrench lasted a few months and then also stripped out at the nut. You put stress on those threads every time you tighten the knurled knob at the center of the nut to lock the setting. The threads can't take more than a few uses. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Squillace

customer_reviews.title: Super important tool
customer_reviews.text: I have this items "big brother" (ft-lbs) and now added the smaller version (in-lbs). Having this range is super important if you want to do quality automotive work. These devices are affordable, easy to use and accurate. Use the case, don't drop it and store it at the lowest torque value and they will never let you down.
customer_reviews.author: RickyPetite

customer_reviews.title: BROKE ROCKER STUD
customer_reviews.text: I am upset, it did not click, I was very careful, went slow, I thought that it should have clicked at 37lbs but it did not. as a result I broke a rocker stud, now I have to but a rocker stud, and could not finish installing the head on my engine. I do notnow how there are so many high reviews, this think is no good.
customer_reviews.author: Res2429

customer_reviews.title: Is it accurate?
customer_reviews.text: First shipment came with a broken wrench. The ball bearing detent that holds the socket was missing. Getting the replacement was super easy though. Second wrench, i dont know if i can trust it. I used the luggage weight scale technique to check its calibration and it seems to be off by 30%. I know the luggage scale is spot on cause i used work out weights to check. Now i dont know if i can trust the wrench or do i just make a calibration card to compensate for the discrepancy.
customer_reviews.author: curyfury

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate, not happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to use while putting my Subaru front end back together. On the FIRST BOLT I used it on (45ft lbs) it stripped out the tapped housing. I decided to lessen the setting by 5lbs and tried the other side. It did the same thing! I know this is an inexpensive tool but I thought the reviews were enough to give it a shot...not so much. It's too bad because it does feel like a decent quality tool. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: RM Jeeps

customer_reviews.title: Consistently accurate, easy to use, hard to read though.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to have a torque range over 150ftlbs. I tested the accuracy by torquing a lug to 100ftlbs using a different tq wrench and this clicked as it should. Like my other tekton 1/2 tq wrench, the tq settings are very hard to see in lower light situations. As with most tq wrenches store it at the lowest setting. The tool is really long and was instrumental when torquing 180ftlbs recently. I recommend for the weekend garage tool collection. Might hold up well in professional garages as a backup tq wrench. it feels well made and has a nice finish to it.
customer_reviews.author: Greener

customer_reviews.title: Complete junk, don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Wrench was clearly not calibrated when it arrived. I set it to 20 ft lbs to torque down an oil pan bolt on my motorcycle. Next thing I know, split and cracked oil pan. Wrench clearly overtorqued the bolt which caused the pan to split apart. So now I have to replace the entire oil pan on the engine. Don't waste your money on this. Read the other reviews and see how many people complain about calibration issues with this wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Jan S

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, ratcheting mechanism broken out of the box
customer_reviews.text: After reading a bunch of different reviews, both here @ amazon and other sites, I decided to completely revamp my torque wrench lineup with new 1/4", 3/8", 1/2" and 3/4" wrenches. All of them Tekton. All of them work great.. except the 3/8". Out of the box the ratcheting mechanism did not work properly. After resetting it back and forth I could get it to ratchet some but then it would swivel 45-90 degrees before catching. Now it won't work at all. (FYI it was used to torque something one time @ 32lbs.) Unfortunately I did not open or use this item until it was after my Amazon period expired.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Nelson-Yurt

customer_reviews.title: Broke on 4th Use
customer_reviews.text: I've used this wrench specifically for torquing my auto wheel lug nuts and wheel brake calipers. I've had it for 9 months. I went to use it for the 4th time and it fell apart. The end cap screw/nut system on the handle end of the wrench separated rendering the wrench useless. I have been unable to repair the wrench. Perhaps the internals are broken. This item should last 10 years or more for the occasional use I throw it. I'll avoid this brand from now on.
customer_reviews.author: techluck

customer_reviews.title: Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance and bought this torque wrench "Used". YOU SHOULD HAVE LISTED IT AS DAMAGED AND NON FUNCTIONAL. It does not work. On the box has a large sticker that says "Inspected". Inspected How. What makes it worst is that I'm now not in the US so I cant send it back. How do you guys inspect the stuff you re sell to people? The blemishes i understand, but it doesnt perform the main and only task it was made to do. The ratchet mechanism is broken!!!!! Do not buy any used measuring tools from Amazon. They are not being check properly before they are resold. "Inspected" my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it, and cal comparisons were good!
customer_reviews.text: I waited a while to review this. I’ve used multiple times and so far it’s worked well. I even took it to work and matched torque values with some much more expensive ones and they compared very well. My only complaint is not about item, it’s the person who bought one, probably used it and returned it. It seemed used when I got it but match calibration comparisons so I kept it. I don’t like returning items so as long as cals matched then Ok. They few minor scratches I can deal with. I’ve got lots of use for this and it’s perfect for my home use.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Great Wrench! Affordable Price!
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm! I bought this one because I needed a dependable but affordable torque wrench in order to work on my motorcycle. It Excelled at its job! The click was very audible and easy to feel. The wrench itself is made out of sturdy metal and is easy to operate. READ THE INSTRUCTIONS AND VERIFY UNITS! The instructions provide guidance about using newton meters as well as gives great directions on use and how to dial in the correct setting. To maintain accuracy the wrench must be stored AT 10 FT-LB.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate, sheared off bolts inside crankcase cover
customer_reviews.text: My wrench was not accurate. It sheared off the bolts inside the crankcase cover during an oil filter change. Luckily I was able to extract the bolts by turning them with needle nose pliers but I was close to needing a new crankcase cover. Make friends with a mechanic and get whatever they recommend, and then have them verify that it's accurate.
customer_reviews.author: J. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Under torques out of the box--make sure you verify calibration before use
customer_reviews.text: I tested the torque wrench using a 10.2 pound weight and string hung 9" from the center of the square drive, equating to 91.8 in-lb. I tested at a hair under the 92 in-lb setting and consistently got a click at about the 8" mark, equating to just over a 10 in-lb under-torque "miss." I wish I had checked this before replacing my valve covers; fortunately even this much error is still within spec for the repair, but this discovery is still alarming for a precision tool that was used once.
customer_reviews.author: jdb

customer_reviews.title: Great torque wrench for the money
customer_reviews.text: I needed a torque wrench for suspension work on my 2007 Nissan Titan and I wanted to get a torque wrench without breaking the bank. Look no further then this Tekton 1/2" torque wrench. I am in the Navy and I work on a ship in the NASSCO (General Dynamics) shipyard. They (being NASSCO) use this torque wrench to certify and torque bolts on our systems. Enough said. I'm sold. Feels great in the hands as far as quality and weight and torque numbers are easy to read and set. I'd post pictures but looks like that feature has been removed by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Felix Perez

customer_reviews.title: Not for small jobs.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for high ft lb torque jobs, failed at low. 5 stars when used to replace brake pads and rotors, however when used to install an oil pressure sensor requiring 12 ft lbs of torque, this wrench failed when set at 10 lbs. Ended up cracking and breaking the head of the engine it went into; no "popping" sound or warning.
customer_reviews.author: Bob from Accounting

customer_reviews.title: Solid Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Tekton torque wrench I've owned, and I continue to be satisfied with the brand. The tool is pretty straight-forward to use, like virtually all torque-wrenches, and the markings are easy to read even when smudged with grease or other car fluids. The tool itself is sturdy and comes in a well constructed plastic case. I've had no issues applying some pretty good force to this tool without worrying about damage to the tool (a banjo bolt was not so lucky last time). I liked this tool enough I bought the next size of it as well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Woody

customer_reviews.title: TEKTON needs a recall on this. Poorly made Torque Wrench.
customer_reviews.text: Was good till the 2nd or 3rd use. Went to Torque a bolt. And it failed to click causing me to over tighten the bolt as others have listed. It was stored at recommended in/pds. TEKTON replaced the wrench but I'm afraid it might happen again? Would`ve rather have my money back. :(
customer_reviews.author: The Real Deal

customer_reviews.title: ... spring inside this wrench snapped and rendered the tool USELESS the FIRST time I tried to use it
customer_reviews.text: The spring inside this wrench snapped and rendered the tool USELESS the FIRST time I tried to use it. Very disappointing. Unfortunately, it was more than 30 days past delivery that I needed it, and it cannot be returned. I now have a $90 door stop. Thanks, Tekton.
customer_reviews.author: Lewellan222

customer_reviews.title: Year Old - One Never Seemed to Work - Both Not Working at all After Less than 10 Uses
customer_reviews.text: One year ago on October 12, 2015 I purchased both the 1/2 and 1/4 Tekton Torque wrenches due to their high ratings. I bought them to work on my dirt bike. The 1/2 inch never seemed to be calibrated right (only used it to tighten the rear axle) and the 1/4 seemed to work for a while but now neither work after less than 10 uses between the two of them. NEVER used them to loosen bolts. Even if i set the torque much lower than needed...it never "clicks" anymore to indicate it reached the specified setting. I spent $80+ dollars on these and I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for the occasional wrencher.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for working on my motorcycle. When I've compared the torque value to other torque wrenches they have always agreed. So either they are both off exactly the same, or it's accurate. I have two criticisms: 1- it frequently gets stuck while changing the torque value. I can hear/feel it snagging at times. 2- It doesn't have enough range of motion. It doesn't do small movements. So in tight spaces, it is sub-optimal. It could use a higher tooth count. As an occasional home-wrencher I'm happy with it. If I were going to be using it a lot, I would get a different wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Hooliator

customer_reviews.title: Works good. Would like to see better locknut.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's a good torque wrench. I bought it to torque the lug nuts on my truck and travel trailer. It works fine, but I find that the adjustment locknut doesn't always stay secure. It could be user error, but it often creep up or down a few lbs before I'm done using it. I could probably really crank down on the locknut, but not sure that's the best approach. I still use it, and like it. I'll just be paying closer attention to the adjustment while I'm using it. Seems like great quality though, and the ratcheting action is smooth and clearly audible.
customer_reviews.author: subzerolv

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, exceptional value!
customer_reviews.text: This torque wrench works fantastic! I think it should be considered a "best buy" tool. I used to have a Snap on torque wrench which arguably the best on the market, and certainly the most expensive. I rarely used it, so I sold it. I now own a couple of trailers and a UTV, so I decided I needed another heavy duty wrench. I didn't want to spend as much for occasional use, so I looked at reviews and decided on this Tekton wrench. I have bought some other Tekton products on Amazon and they were all great quality. Anyhow, this far exceeded my expectations! I love it and think it is an exceptional buy.
customer_reviews.author: bobwhitebarry

customer_reviews.title: Awesome piece.
customer_reviews.text: Yay. My first torque wrench... Used this to torque in my caliper slider bolts when I did my brakes. Plus.... My bolts on the tires are torqued in at 100 foot pounds. Who knew there was a best setting for them? . Easy to read, gives a nice click when level is reached and yessssss. My neighbor has already come to borrow my new wrench. I like that it is in its own case so it is protected. I got the 1/2 inch ,but I think I will add to my sizes for a just in case thing.
customer_reviews.author: K. Beyer

customer_reviews.title: Its a beast!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was at the upper limits of my Craftsman 1'2 drive to torque axle nuts. It is well made. Very very similar to what Harbor freight carries but the fit and finish on the Tekton is obvioulsy better. Well worth a few extra dollars to get this instead.
customer_reviews.author: dxpope

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Strong - But there was a slight learning curve to setting the tension setting!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep in the back of my car in-case I ever have to change my tires. Well! It of course happened - tire blew out on the side of the road. Got this guy out after putting on the spare, but had a little it of trouble setting it to the correct tension. I was slightly confused how to use it at first, and the directions weren't very clear (to be honest, it was probably user-error...not the products). Eventually, I figured it out just fine, and got the spare tire on there with ease (and at the right tension). Very good product!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Marble

customer_reviews.title: Tekton stands behind their product
customer_reviews.text: Substantial well made product, easy to read scale. Two step operation to set torque, as you compress the tension spring the barrel tightens and you need to unscrew the butt cap to further dial up the torque. Don't know if this is typical of similar wrenches or not. Critical note: you store this wrench at minimum torque setting WHICH IS NOT ZERO. If you dial it back to zero, the butt cap can come off and there is no repair. This happened to me with this wrenches little brother, good news is Tekton stood behind the product and sent a free replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt B

customer_reviews.title: At least my replacement order was a new wrench
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice. Way nicer than the one with worn black paint, worn white numbers, scuffed socket receiver, scratched head I received on my first order. I actually have no way to know how accurate this is (I could compare between the used and new one actually), I wish it was a break-away but those were too expensive. At least I received the replacement within 24 hours so that's good I guess. Hope my dad doesn't mind I left this review on his account.
customer_reviews.author: jabcat7

customer_reviews.title: Accurate at 45 ft-lb for me
customer_reviews.text: This is an apparently well made torque wrench that feels like a quality tool and clicks at 45 ft-lb just as it was set to do. I know this because my mower was blade was torqued to that spec by the dealer, and for me using it in the tighten (clockwise) mode it clicked just as the bolt started to turn. I am happy to be its owner and will guard it as a valuable tool possession for those rare (around my house) missions that call for tightening to specified torque.
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh man

customer_reviews.title: Setting doesn't work on it, applied maximum torque and ruined a balljoint.
customer_reviews.text: Don't get this, it doesn't work. I managed to ruin a ball joint, because the wrench applied maximum torque. Further testing revealed, that it applies maximum torque all the time, doesn't matter what foot pounds you set on. Could be just mine, but why play Russian roulette? Avoid this brand and this item, they obviously don't have a quality control if a precision tool isn't just not calibrated, but doesn't and literally ruins everything it touches. This company owes me another $40 for the tie rod end I had to re-purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NewEnglander

customer_reviews.title: Works good and has a nice heavy quality feel
customer_reviews.text: As a DIYer in my driveway, this has been a great torque wrench. It's pretty heavy, so I think it's going to last for a while. Maybe if I were a mechanic and lived by my tools, I'd go with something by a better known brand. But this should be fine for occasional use. Once you set the torque setting and tighten the nut on the bottom, it doesn't loosen, however I find that as I'm torquing something down, I look at the setting and the ft-lbs have increased by 1-2 ft-lbs. I wish it clicked into the specified setting a little better, but this may be just a function of these twist style torque wrenches.
customer_reviews.author: Tokuzumi

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't make a clicking sound that you can hear, you just have to feel it.
customer_reviews.text: So I complained to Tekton about the fact that this torque wrench doesn't really make an audible click. They explained that since it's a smaller TW, it doesn't have as much stored energy so you'll just see/feel when you've reached the right torque spec (...we hope). I get that this is a smaller TW so the physics will be different than the larger versions. But since the primary reason I bought this thing is to torque valve cover bolts to spec, it's kinda sorta important to know EXACTLY when those bolts are tightened enough. A snapped valve cover bolt is a bitch to fix, believe me.
customer_reviews.author: R. Burgundy

customer_reviews.title: Too few ratchet teeth
customer_reviews.text: Bought this torque wrench based on the torque range and customer reviews. The first use was to torque new spark plugs in a 2003 Porsche Boxster. Not much room even with the rear tires removed. There are so few ratchet teeth the grip end travels more than six inches between clicks. That would work for lug nuts but not for even moderately close work such as suspension or engine work on the Porsche. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Hambone

customer_reviews.title: This thing is huge but requires little effort to use
customer_reviews.text: I was doing some work on my Jeep Wrangler that required me to set the torque on the suspension components to something higher than the torque wrench that I already had. I was surprised at how big it was but it makes sense as torquing up a pitman arm nut takes quite a bit of force. I had to buy a 3/4" to 1/2" adapter but now I don't think there is any thing that I can't torque to the right force.
customer_reviews.author: pablomac

customer_reviews.title: Best price I could find and works for what I need
customer_reviews.text: This torque wrench arrived in new working condition. I did a few tests to make sure the readings were accurate and used it for my project. It is certainly not as high quality as others i have used but it's 1/3rd the cost and gets the job done. The adjustment handle is a bit too stiff (yes i loosened the lock on the bottom all the way). But again, it works and seems to be the best bang for the buck. Thanks Tekton!
customer_reviews.author: MagicMike

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Had high hopes
customer_reviews.text: Update: Company was responsive within 3 hours of my email and are issuing a replacement. Great service. Apparently the tool fell out of calibration because I turned the torque setting below 20in-lb. I wish the tool would prevent the user from loosening the handle below the minimum setting. ------------ After 6 weeks , Worked three times then failed. Now I have a over torqued bolt due to the wrench never clicking. Won't even click at the lowest setting now. Poor quality. Had high hopes, now I'm out two expensive bolts on my bike that must be replaced due to over torque.
customer_reviews.author: MetalMan

customer_reviews.title: terrible experience....
customer_reviews.text: I am not a mechanics..however i know how to use a wrench and can read and follow the instructions...I bought this to replace my zero turn mower blades....needs 75-85 ft lbs torque....this wrench DID NOT work out of the box!!!! I tried everything and possibly over tighten the blade bolts....then i reduced the torque to 30-50 ft lbs still no "click" ... I rely on the tool and tighten the bolt with all my power to hear a "click" or hoping to hear a "click" ..I am very disappointed...I am going to home depot today and will buy HUSKY torque wrench...I will return TEKTON wrench....
customer_reviews.author: victor

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price. Recommended for the weekend mechanic.
customer_reviews.text: I've used better quality items in the past, but for the price this is great. Though I couldn't do any sort of calibration tests, it felt solid and when I used it, the weight applied when torquing was as expected. I'm going to add that with recent contact by the manufacturer, I'm given a sense of reassurance and greater trust in the wrench. I am very pleased that the manufacturer reached out and made it known they are available if any problems were to creep up. This shows a positive, proactive customer service approach and I can really appreciate that.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Something came loose inside
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this wrench November 2014 has worked until today May 2016. First time I tried to use the lower settings (12 pounds) it would not click. Also, Now it will not work below 20 pounds. At lower settings the head is loose and the spring seems loose when set at the lower settings. Now I can not trust it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this torque wrench for attaching flashing lugs that require 21 ft/lbs torque. I noticed that this wrench seemed to have quote a window for when it 'clicks'. It is no very precise. Also the click is very subtle and if you missed it, the wrench will happily let you keep tightening until you snap the bolt. So in my opinion this torque wrench is hard to use, hard to calibrate (due to wide click window). I would go for a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Duxa

customer_reviews.title: Gettin' Tek
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done, but don't expect to use it in tight spots. This thing is massive. Use this for the big ones like suspension torque values on my car. Lug nuts, too. The only issues I have with it are the tightening/loosening of the bottom screw that you must use in order to set the torque , it's a little tedious. But I'm thinking of looping something through it to make it easier. Also wish it had more teeth. Trying to set the torque on rear differential drain plugs without ramps just isn't going to happen with this behemoth, at least not for my Subaru.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony T

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable tool
customer_reviews.text: As far as I'm concerned, EVERY mechanic needs at least one torque wrench, if not more. I'm far from an expert on what constitutes a great torque wrench, but I find it easy to set, easy to use (except it's LONG and HEAVY...like lifting it over your head and you feel like shouting "By the power of Grayskull"), and does the job right. So, in summary, I've bought 2 of these (one is the 1/2" version and the other is the 3/8" version) because they work and the price is right. Kinda no brainer...
customer_reviews.author: jmiers

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to risk my vehicle's safety with a sketchy torque stick from a store that sells freight from a harbor, so I bought this one. It was very affordable and comes with a carrying case. The tool also comes with instructions. I bought it along with an impact and reducer set made by the same brand since I was using it to torque down both bolts and lug nuts. One suggestion: if you are buying a torque wrench, be sure to buy locktight compound to keep them torqued, and a breaker bar to loosen them later. Just don't use locktight on lug nuts, of course.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and wildly inaccurate!
customer_reviews.text: This wrench has terrible accuracy and the actual torque settings go down Exponentially As you go up in 10 ftlb at a time. It stripped two bolts that needed to be torqued at 15 ftlb when I had it at 11 ftlb. The settings are confusing it’s hard to tell where you actually line up the bottom twist cap. Not I have to get two bolt holes re drilled on my ktm and come up with a fix. Don’t buy this cheap garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Attack

customer_reviews.title: I'm definitely satisfied with the quality of this wrench
customer_reviews.text: I use torque wrenches, now that I bought a few, regularly. It provides peace of mind knowing that the fasteners are to spec. I'm definitely satisfied with the quality of this wrench. I use it for lug nuts and other large fasteners on my vehicles. My only gripe would be how the torque setting is locked down on the end of the wrench. The knurled lock doesn't stay tight 100% of the time and sometimes I find my torque value has changed by a pound or two. Not worth removing a star from the rating over that. I just make it a point to spot check it from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Lee B.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Wrench
customer_reviews.text: I am not a mechanic and I do not use this tool daily. Just a DIY'er with no need for running a tab with a tool truck. I've had it a while now and used it replacing lowering control arms on two vehicles and to tighten lug nuts when needed. Used it maybe a dozen times so far. Had my friend calibrate it last month and it's dead on the money. Not sure if it would hold up to a shop mechanic abuse but it's a solid buy for the money for the average guy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew I.

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working at 35ft-lbs but would work fine at 33
customer_reviews.text: The click intermittently worked. I had used it with no issue for many bolts/nuts. It stopped working at 35ft-lbs but would work fine at 33. After resetting it to 35 it would start working again. I can't trust this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: This torque wrench malfunctioned after tightening 2 bolts. On ...
customer_reviews.text: This torque wrench malfunctioned after tightening 2 bolts. On the third bolt, there was no feedback when the dialed-in torque level had been reached and the bolt sheared off. What a shock. I was re-installing the mounting bracket on a disc brake on my mountain bike. Luckily it was the bolt on the mount and not the bolt on the frame that sheared off, so all I needed to do was replace the mount rather than have to drill out the bolt on the frame. I returned this for a CDI torque wrench. Pricey, but I am hoping it is worth the upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: sgkritzik

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great quality
customer_reviews.text: Torque wrench seems to be great quality, finish is great, and it works well. I needed a new one being that the numbering on my old torque wrench was not legible any longer, and I needed a wrench that would go up to 140lb ft for our larger vehicles. I am a huge Craftsman fan, but for the price of the Tekton torque wrench, you just can't beat it. I will likely be buying some of Tekton's other tools.
customer_reviews.author: jeri

customer_reviews.title: Lost its calibration - reset it myself
customer_reviews.text: When I received my wrench, the large nut on the end of the handle was loose. I would just tighten it by hand but didn't realize that it was also turning the threaded sleeve to which it's attached. That sleeve adjusts the pre-load on the spring to calibrate the wrench. I watched a video online on how to calibrate this model wrench with a luggage scale. It's easy to do and something you might want to check on a regular basis with any torque wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R.

customer_reviews.title: My go to torque wrench now
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to torque wrench it’s robust but not as heavy as some of the ones we get from our tool truck, the click is nice and loud, only reason I give it 4 stars for use is because the lock mechanics sometimes comes undone or is hard to figure out in a rush but I probably only have that about once a week and I use the thing 24/7 and have had it for over a year with and it’s still within 1.6% which is crazy to me my snap on went wonky after only a few months of heavy use! will defiantly buy another one when it’s needed!
customer_reviews.author: lil ganster

customer_reviews.title: Arrived unusable needing calibration.....no help from company
customer_reviews.text: This torque wrench arrived with its handle, which selects the torque setting of the wrench, did you line up with the markings making the wrench unusable. I tried to us it anyways but it stripped the nut I was trying to torque. I called the number on the paper work that came with the wrench which said DON'T RETURN PRODUCT IF THERE IS A PROBLEM PLEASE CALL US! Well I called the number and no one ever answered. I left two messages with no call back. So I guess I'm stuck with a tool that does nothing now.
customer_reviews.author: Joe The Electrician

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't very happy with this torque wrench. The adjusting mechanism was very rough, and when adjusting to the upper end of the range, difficult. I was looking for something less expensive than the professional tools and have had good luck with Tekton in the past. Unfortunately this tool didn't inspire confidence. I also felt that over time the rough adjustment would wear on my nerves. If you need this for extremely seldom use, or rough difficult adjustment doesn't bother you, it probably serves it's function just fine. Just don't expect a professional (or even home mechanic) level tool
customer_reviews.author: Bloose

customer_reviews.title: Good Torque Wrench
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this at 100 ft. lbs. so far, and it seems ok. It has a very audible click, and can be felt easily as well. I took one star off because the lock knob on the bottom is finicky. It tends to work it's way loose. However, I think with use (wearing in) and practice, this knob will function better. This is a very long torque wrench. I have used many torque wrenches, this one is the longest by far. That's great if you want/need more leverage. It is bad if space is a problem. It does ratchet in both directions. It only torque's in one direction. (It will not work on left hand threaded fasteners.)
customer_reviews.author: DavidTN

customer_reviews.title: It's a fantastic torque wrench and I'd highly recommend it to anyone ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this to install spark plugs and running boards. It definitely has trouble with the consistency of torque applied at 13.5N/m. However, it's really +/- 0.2N/m and for what purposes many of us will be using it for that doesn't matter much. I compared torque using two separate torque wrenches, one from MAC and another from SK. I borrowed these from Uncles to give you the above variance in torque for the Tekton. It's a fantastic torque wrench and I'd highly recommend it to anyone who does their own car maintenance or plans to. For mechanics, I feel it'd be worth the extra cash and just buying a better MAC or SK wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Shane M.

customer_reviews.title: this tool is accurate, and I can vouch for ...
customer_reviews.text: this tool is accurate, and I can vouch for the incredible customer service that tekton offers. I originally thought it was not accurate after running a test that I later discovered was faulty reasoning, and even after I explained my methods to the agent who suggested that I may be drawing inaccurate conclusions, he still offered a replacement..I then decided to learn about torque and after running real tests discovered the error of my ways and found the tool was completely accurate. thanks tekton
customer_reviews.author: Nick 1983

customer_reviews.title: Used and inoperable
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived used and inoperable. It appeared to have been taken apart and put back together. Other reviewers have had similar complaints. One wonders if Amazon is not properly checking returned items or the manufacturer has some quality control issues. In either case, thoroughly inspect the item when you receive it. Cheers
customer_reviews.author: Paco

customer_reviews.title: Won’t reach 80lbft
customer_reviews.text: Needed a smaller torque wrench for a brake job. I had good luck with their 1/2 version so I went ahead and got their 3/8 version. Didn’t expect it to be a total trash. It doesn’t turn all the way to 80lbft, gets extremely hard to turn right about 70lbft. Went to harbor freight and got the $20 dollar one and it works great. Future buyers Don’t waste time and money on this POS. Returned
customer_reviews.author: Grimmjow

customer_reviews.title: Not well made, quickly stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the savings in price at all!! Used maybe a dozen times then just stopped working. I have emailed Texton hopefully they will back up there support and exchange but I'd be very careful if your using it on softer metals easily strip of the wrench is broken, which it was in my case. Worst case sceniro you will Have a expensive breaker bar.
customer_reviews.author: 2Big Mutts

customer_reviews.title: TEKTON 1/2 Inch Drive Click Torque Wrench (25-250 ft.-lb.)
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to big boy now. I had to have for axle nuts on my car and this did it. Can't say how accurate it is as I don't have a test stand for this size, yet. At about 30 inches the pull is still pretty good to take it to my torque need. Seem pretty well made and comes in the usual plastic box which is nice for storing it. Price was good too. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: gtoolmaker

customer_reviews.title: Solid unit, only a few small issues.
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well. Long handle is great for the higher settings. I did have an issue with the ratcheting system binding up, seems the 2 torx screws were tightened down a little too much causing it to bind up. simply loosening them a bit solved the issue. Also, be sure to double check that the handle is properly locked down before using as well as it can be easy to not fully lock it and have the settings change on you during use. Overall though great Torque wrench for the price and seems accurate when tested against my other torque wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Joe G.

customer_reviews.title: How long will it last?
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use Torque wrench and seems accurate. I would have given it 5 stars, but the adaptors which were made by TEKTON and purchased at the same time were a very dangerous and inferior product. The largest one sheared off using a basic ratchet wrench--not even a torque drive. So, while this item appears well built and accurate, I question how durable it will be based on the horrific performance of the TEKTON adaptor set.
customer_reviews.author: Gen. Contractor

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for inch pounds and the scale is for foot pounds. There is a paper with a conversion table. And I would not consider the wrench scale to be accurate. For example, when the handle is perfectly aligned at 95 foot pounds, the sliding scale on the handle reads 5 and not 0. So is that 95 foot pounds or 100? It’s a guess. I like this company’s wrenches, but not this torque wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Bonomi

customer_reviews.title: Ok but 1 big problem
customer_reviews.text: I was fairly certain the description stated that this wrench would work in either direction. Partially true. It does, in fact, both loosen and tighten. The problem is that it only works as a torque wrench while tightening. That's a problem for reverse threaded connections. Same issue with the 3/8" Tekton toque etch l wrench I recently purchased. But it seems to be well made. Just don't try to get a reading on reverse threads.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage! This has wrecked more than one of my projects because it simply doesn’t work! After I sheered off a bolt in a transmission valve body tonight, I checked it against a bolt tightened with another torque wrench. Even when I set it three to four ft lb lower, it still didn’t even click! Save your money, and your projects, and DO NOT BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Owen Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Tested for Accuracy on all ranges
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a few months now and I never compared or tested for accuracy until today. I used 2 other torque wrench to compare this in terms of accuracy. It is very well calibrated to proper torque spec as stated on the printed paper it comes with. Perhaps maybe 3-5ft lbs off but still very very close when put to test with a more expensive tool. If you get one be sure to test it. Great bang for the buck!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: AMENDED: works well
customer_reviews.text: AMENDED: I had to amend my original 1-star review. This torque wrench did not work on a couple of bolts I was installing in some Air Lift bladders for my truck. For some reason the "click" never happened on those bolts and I think it might be due to the bolts being threaded into brass inserts in the airbags (can't say for sure). That said, will all other connections on this product, the wrench seemed to work according to the instructions. I only gave it 4 stars due to the issue with the air bag bolts. Those were supposed to be installed to 20 foot pounds and I could not verify that that happened with this wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Spauld

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Something about owning a torque wrench makes me somehow feel more mechanically inclined. :) I've been looking for things to torque. I used while replacing struts on my Camry. I had never used a torque wrench before so really did not know what to expect. The included directions are easy to follow and the click is easy to hear and feel. I've also used it to torque lug nuts. To my surprise I have been over tightening them. Wrench seems well constructed, has a good range and even comes in a plastic case for storage. I'm very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for 20lbs+ Use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this torque wrench for automotive use. First thing I noticed was that it was a bit off at the 10lbs. setting. I was trying to add 10lbs. to some thermostat housing bolts and it started to feel too close to breaking them before hearing the click, so I stopped short. It did great on the 13mm bolts for 40lbs. as I raised it from 10lbs to 40lbs. in 5lbs. increments to lube it for first time use. For the price it's not bad, but I would still have it checked for calibration and don't use for 10lbs (you don't even need it for 10lbs, just tighten a bit with common sense).
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Get it if you need it.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT USE THIS UNLESS YOU NEED IT. This wrench will break your bolts, only use this one of heavy bolts if you have small stuff either tighten the bolts with a normal wrench or get the one that's smaller than this one. 4 stars because there was no warnings and I ended up breaking 3 bolts because this wrench gives you way too much leverage.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Solid as a Rock
customer_reviews.text: This is a big, strong tool, but I didn't have to over-pay for it. I am glad that I didn't buy the cheapest torque wrench out there, but also glad it didn't cost a ton. This torque wrench looks like it means business. I used it to tighten down all my steering parts dealing with the Pitman arm and Idler arm. I've never used a torque wrench before but finally decided to quit using my common sense and buy a torque wrench. Still, I am betting I did my brake job last year without a torque wrench all right. I hope so anyways. I simply tightened the hell out of those caliper bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Quinlan

customer_reviews.title: Tekton is great
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived from Amazon with some loose parts floating around in the case and Tekton not only helped me figure out where they went, but they also sent me a replacement torque wrench just in case the original one wasn't accurate. Absolutely amazing customer service from Tekton and I would consider buying their tools over Craftsman, Kobalt and similar brands that offer a lifetime warranty but never seem to stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: kismet1113

customer_reviews.title: which would theoretically be useful on wheel lug nuts (factory spec is 76 ft-lb)
customer_reviews.text: The clicking sound makes the wrench much easier to use than the Craftsman torque wrench with a floating needle (so have to look at that part to know when the right torque was achieved) that I bought and never used. Perhaps my hands are not strong enough, but I don't really see myself tightening the wrench all the way up to the 80 ft-lb capacity, which would theoretically be useful on wheel lug nuts (factory spec is 76 ft-lb). I think I am only able to tighten the wrench to about 50 ft-lb, which is still sufficient for vast majority of potential applications for me.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Massively solid tool...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because you can't always read the digital readout and/or hear the tone from a digital model, (like my rich buddy has). :p This is a solid tool, easy to use, (although the scales stamped on it are hard on my ancient eyes) and the click is impossible to miss even when working upside down, out of sight under a pickup. It is a hefty chunk of metal so be prepared to muscle it...
customer_reviews.author: BZ Avatar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for the price. Highly recommend this torque wrench.
customer_reviews.text: This torque wrench is easy to use for putting lug nuts on cars and blades on riding lawn mowers. The long handle makes it possible to set the lug nut torque without difficulty. The online sales video was informative and helpful. The wrench comes with a good quality molded plastic case. Excellent quality at a very reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Sue's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Seems Like a Quality Tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wrench to torque down the intake manifold bolts on a Ford 2nd generation engine. The wrench worked great. I checked the calibration with some weights and it seemed right on. The directions say to operate the wrench a few times if it has been sitting a while. It said that relubricates the internal parts. I did that assuming it may have been sitting in Amazon’s warehouse a while.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great budget torque wrench with one complaint
customer_reviews.text: 3 month update: stopped working, clicking sound still strong, audible, and felt when tightening but it does absolutely nothing. 70lb vs 100lb on the same lug did not move and gave same audible click. It is basically a placebo, do not use on your tires or else risk loose lugs. Strong clicking noise, performs the same as higher priced torque wrenches. My only concern is even though storing it at 10 ft lb's as suggested, some oil/gunk was found at the bottom as if it was leaking. Not a lot of oil/gunk so not worth returning as it still works. Worth the money if you're on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: user

product_meta.title: TEKTON 1/2 Inch Drive Click Torque Wrench (10-150 ft.-lb.) | 24335
product_meta.description:
Style:1/2 Inch Drive (10-150 ft.-lb.)

Calibrated to an accuracy of +/ 4%, the TEKTON 1/2 in. Drive Click Torque Wrench lets you work with confidence, eliminating guessing and the common tendency to overtighten fasteners. Correctly tightening fasteners to a vehicle or equipment manufacturer's torque specifications ensures parts are properly secured without being damaged. Simple and easy to use, this wrench has a reversible ratcheting head that drives fasteners in both directions and measures torque in the clockwise direction. To measure torque, set the desired value on the handle scale (foot pounds or Newton meters) and begin tightening the fastener. When the preset torque value is reached, a reliable mechanical operation inside the handle produces a click you can hear and feel, alerting you to stop applying force. Built for consistent performance and years of dependable service, the mechanical design doesn't need batteries, and the allsteel construction has no plastic parts to break or wear out.

IMPORTANT: This wrench is shipped precalibrated and ready to use. To help maintain calibration, store at its lowest setting of 10 ft.lb./13.6 Nm when not in use. Be sure to read and understand the operator's manual, including all safety information, before first use.

Specifications:

 * Range - ft.-lb.: 10-150 ft.-lb.
 * Range - Nm: 13.6-203.5 Nm
 * Increment: 1 ft.-lb. (1.36 Nm)
 * Accuracy: ± 4 percent
 * Length: 18-3/8 inch
 * Ratchet: 24 tooth
 * Country of Origin: Taiwan



Includes:

 * (1) 1/2 in. drive torque wrench
 * (1) Storage case
 * (1) Operator's manual with torque conversion chart
feature_bullets: Includes storage case and product manual with torque conversion chart
Wrench emits a click that can be heard and felt when the preset value is reached
High-contrast dual-range scale is easy to read, even in low light
Reversible ratchet head drives in both directions and measures torque in clockwise direction
Durable all-steel construction has no plastic parts to break or wear out
Ships pre-calibrated to +/- 4% accuracy and ready to use

specifications.Included Components: Storage case, Product manual with torque conversion chart, 1-pc. 1/2 in. drive torque wrench
specifications.Warranty Description: No time limits, no receipts: tekton.com/tool-help
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars12,546 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
